title: ICE: Unexpected type returned from struct_tail

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
``` rust
enum Foo {
    Bar(int, [int]),
}

fn main() {
    // Either of these lines can cause the ICE
    let _x: &(int, [int]);
    let _y: &Foo;
}
```

Backtrace:

```
   1:     0x7f2a127e8580 - rt::backtrace::imp::write::h0180e7ded76a3ff2c0q
   2:     0x7f2a127eb770 - failure::on_fail::h3f169393c89b5f90Tlr

  35:     0x7f2a1227f0c0 - start_thread
  36:     0x7f2a12c99359 - __clone
  37:                0x0 - <unknown>
```

This seems to occur when using a non-struct type that contains an unsized type. This is probably because [`unsized_part_of_type`](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/7932b719ec2b65acfa8c3e74aad29346d47ee992/src/librustc/middle/ty.rs#L2938-L2956) only handles `ty_struct` and the base unsized types. This should be extended to handle enums and tuples as well.
